conclusion: Analyze the motion of both the pedestrian and the bus using the given velocity-time graphs.
The pedestrian runs at a constant speed.
The bus starts from rest and accelerates uniformly.
The bus reaches a speed of 8 m/s in 8 seconds.
The acceleration of the bus is 1 m/s².
The distance covered by the pedestrian in time t is 8t.
The distance covered by the bus in time t is 0.5t².
Initially, the pedestrian is 36 meters behind the bus.
The relative distance between the pedestrian and the bus is 0.5t² + 36 - 8t.
The pedestrian catches up with the bus when the relative distance is 0.
Multiply through by 2 to get t² - 16t + 72 = 0.
Use the quadratic formula to solve for t.
The discriminant is negative, so there are no real solutions for t.
The pedestrian cannot catch up with the bus.
